svcsubproc.title: Emergency Window Exits
svcsubproc.para: Emergency exit windows on the RE bus body consist of two different style assemblies, a horizontally hinged and a vertically hinged emergency exit window. Both sets of windows are installed from inside the bus and are secured by a mounting cover plate.

note.para: The push-out / kick - out windows are equipped with buzzer alarms switches. The switch wires are routed from the window latch to the window header. The switches are connected to a driver warning buzzer located at the driver position. Inspect the wire routing.

step1.para: Horizontally Hinged Kick-out Windows and Vertically Hinged Kick-out Windows

step2.para: Remove the four mounting screws securing the window mounting cover plates each side of the window assembly (see Figure 170).
Tilt the top of the window in and away from the bus light bar assembly. (see Figure 171).
Lift the window assembly up and out of the window opening.
Locate the buzzer wire connection and disconnect.
Remove the caulking seal that may remain in the window opening.
